FuncDef:
The l2tp icrq-limit command configures the maximum number of ICRQ packets that the LNS can process per second.
The undo l2tp icrq-limit command restores the default configuration.
By default, there is no limit on the number of ICRQ packets that the LNS can process per second.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the maximum number of ICRQ packets that the LNS can process per second.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 60000.

ExtraInfo: If a large number of users are going online in a period of time, too many ICRQ packets may be sent, causing subsequent users to fail to go online. To limit the number of ICRQ packets that the LNS can process per second, run the l2tp icrq-limit command.
